content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Initializing an empty string to hold the extracted julia code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Regular expression pattern to match markdown code blocks
    code_block_pattern = r"^```julia\n([\s\S]+?)\n```$"m

    # Loop through each line in the markdown document
    for line in split(md, "\n")
        # If a line matches the code block pattern, append the content inside the code block to the extracted code
        if match(code_block_pattern, line) !== nothing
            content = strip(match(code_block_pattern, line).captures[1])
            extracted_code *= "\n" * content
        end
    end

    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the extracted code
    return stripped_code = replace(extracted_code, r"^\s+|\s+$"m => "")
end
```
